I started signing when I was three years old. 
But British Sign Language was not considered a true language until 2003. 
As an adult it is very useful in loud environments and across large distances in places when it is socially unacceptable to shout. 
It‚Äôs easy to learn. Once you know the alphabet you can spell everything out. The vowels are the easiest a-e-i-o-u. 
Then you can learn individual words like ‚Äúhello‚Äù ‚Äúgood morning‚Äù and ‚Äúgood night‚Äù.
But be careful you do not mix up signs like ‚Äúbrother‚Äù and ‚Äúmilk‚Äù.
Thank you and goodbye.
